artists.name: Nelson Rockwood
artists.title: General Contractor
artists.blurb: Nelson is the only general contractor that could’ve remodeled this house, ‘cuz he’s the only one I’ve ever met with a degree in theatre. Talk about a perfect fit! His hand was in everything, literally, in the house, over the last two years.

artists.name: Ann Tucker
artists.title: Interior Designer
artists.blurb: Ann Tucker is a local interior decorator who’s knowledge, artistry and excitement are unmatched. Her hand is in everything, not just the interior, from the octopus all the way to the creek.

artists.name: Mishka Westell
artists.title: Mural Designer
artists.blurb: Misha is a local artist that specializes in poster art for famous bands. The Octopus House is based on a poster that she made. Also, she’s a total badass.

artists.title: Metal Forgers
artists.blurb: The folks at Pyrology created the mermaid. Isn’t she a beauty! I was privileged to visit their foundry and see them pour metal at thousands of degrees and shape it into fine art.

artists.name: Daniel Hornung
artists.title: Glass Sculptor
artists.blurb: Designing the mermaid was tricky and Daniel was the perfect guy for the job. Do we go classic or mod patina? How does it integrate with the rest? Only Daniel had the chops for this one.

artists.name: Jim Berry
artists.title: Glass Worker
artists.blurb: Jim is an amazing local artist that has been designing and teaching stain glass for decades. His tentacle and starfish stain glass are truly works of incomparable art.

artists.name: Heidi Choate
artists.title: Landscaper
artists.blurb: Heidi is an amazing landscaper and human being. Not only did she design the most interesting yards in Austin but she’s also a true joy to work with.

artists.name: Dan
artists.title: Water Feature Designer
artists.blurb: The water features out front and back are so absolutely beautiful and calming. Everyone that sees them says so. They bring me joy daily.

artists.name: Craig and Teena
artists.title: Wood Carvers
artists.blurb: Craig and Teena did an amazing job at creating the front door, which was especially challenging for its stain glass integration and custom non-linear wave design. Wow!

artists.name: Stuart Simpson
artists.title: Stone Sculptor
artists.blurb: This has been such a wonderful project to be a part of. Joey has been an absolute delight to work with, and has encouraged me from the get-go to use my artistic license, and have fun with the project, which in return has allowed me to fabricate something truly special. Nelson has also been a solid team member to collaborate with throughout the process. This is exactly the type of work I love to do and I am so grateful for this opportunity!

artists.name: Anna B.
artists.title: Skull Artist
artists.blurb: Anna is a local artist that created the Eyes of Texas longhorn skull, which tells the tale of Texas in thousands of beads. Seeing her art under rainbow lights just takes your breath away. Truly.

artists.name: James Talbot
artists.title: Artist Extraordinaire
artists.blurb: My house is nothing compared to Mr. Talbot’s home: Casa Neverlandia. You haven’t lived until you’ve taken a tour of his art house.

artists.name: Evan Voyles
artists.title: Neon Glass Artist
artists.blurb: Evan is a local neon artist and musician. Working with him and getting to know him has been one of the great pleasure of my life.

artists.name: Aaron Flynn
artists.title: Mural Painter
artists.blurb: Aaron Flynn is a local artist that painted the front of the Octopus House, based on Misha’s design. There’s nothing more zen than watching Aaron paint. Truly.

artists.name: Stuart and Dave
artists.title: Steel Artist
artists.blurb: Stuart is a local artist that spend eight months of his life turning two tons of limestone is to a sculpture of Mother Nature, using everything from hydraulic chisels to X-acto knives. Really. He did that.

artists.name: Leo Mejilla
artists.title: Ninja Painter
artists.blurb: Leo is a local painter that painting virtually everything inside and outside of the house. And he’s a ninja! No, seriously, you don’t even know he’s there. Quietest human being I’ve ever met.

artists.name: Donny, Hugo and Brandon
artists.title: Home Automation
artists.blurb: The lights! Oh, the rainbow lights! You haven’t really seen the house until you hit a Rainbow button light switch or lit up the deck concert lights. Wow!

artists.name: Michael
artists.title: Tile Artist
artists.blurb: Watching Michael tile is simply fascinating. Morrocan tile is quite challenging and he did an amazing job laying it out.

artists.name: Aaron Pratt
artists.title: Cabinet Artist
artists.blurb: Aaron took an empty nook in my bedroom and turned it into a bookcase work of art. You can pull a book or a ukelele down! How cool is that?

artifacts.name: THE FACE
artifacts.blurb: A beautiful combination of paint, stain glass, architecture and engineering sets this house apart from all others.

artifacts.name: THE MERMAID
artifacts.blurb: This stunning eye catcher is forged from bronze and brings a delicateness to a strong metal!

artifacts.name: THE DOOR
artifacts.blurb: The entrance to this house is a collaboration of carved African Mahogany with gorgeous stain glass.

artifacts.name: THE GLASS
artifacts.blurb: The stain glass breathes life into the house as it brings an array of glowing colors from the sunlight.

artifacts.name: NEON SEAHORSE
artifacts.blurb: This bright guy brings a certain excitement and flare to the house.

artifacts.name: EYES OF TEXAS
artifacts.blurb: What better way to represent your Texas roots than with this phenomenal beaded Longhorn skull?

artifacts.name: SACRED SPACE
artifacts.blurb: This awe inspiring piece of 19,000 beads brings a serenity to the space.

artifacts.name: MOTHER NATURE
artifacts.blurb: This Goddess is carved from 3 blocks of Texas limestone and embedded with crystals and plants.

artifacts.name: THE TILING
artifacts.blurb: This stunning tile from Morrocco reallyties the room together.

artifacts.name: THE LIGHTS
artifacts.blurb: One of the most integral parts of this house is the lighting, which sets the tone.  Party mode anybody?

artifacts.name: THE BOOKCASE
artifacts.blurb: Not every house has a sexy built in bookshelf designed specifically for the room.

artifacts.name: THE BRAIN
artifacts.blurb: Not many people can take on crazy ideas and make them a beautiful and unique reality.

artifacts.name: THE STYLIST
artifacts.blurb: It takes a special person to explore out of this world ideas and bring them together in a cohesive manner.

artifacts.name: THE GARDENERS
artifacts.blurb: It takes 2 gardeners to tend to this unique octopus garden.

artifacts.name: THE NINJA PAINTER
artifacts.blurb: Need your interior and exterior meticulously painted?  It's even better when you don't even notice them!
